summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Emma
Review Date: 2006/07/28
Store: Kate Beckinsale  (Actor),     Bernard Hepton  (Actor),     Diarmuid Lawrence  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, A&E Home Video, All A&E Titles
Product Description: ["From the producers of A&E's Emmy award winning Pride and Prejudice.", "From the greatest romantic novelist of all time comes a delightfully wicked comedy of love and matchmaking. Jane Austen's sly and vivacious heroines have enchanted readers for more than 200 years. Now, for the first time on DVD, this acclaimed production from the creators of A&E's best selling Pride and Prejudice brings to life one of the most fascinating Austen characters of all time - the charming and mischievous Emma Woodhouse.", "Starring Kate Beckinsale, Emma is the story of a rich, clever and beautiful young woman who can't resist orchestrating other people's love lives. As her romantic plans go ridiculously wrong, however, it's Emma herself who risks missing out on her perfect match!", "Join A&E for a wry visit to the drawing rooms and country manors of 19th-century England - a visit to the enchanting world of Jane Austen's Emma now in the crystal clear digital clarity of DVD."]
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Romance, Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Raymond Coulthard, Bernard Hepton, Dido Miles, James Hazeldine, Samantha Morton, Prunella Scales, Guy Henry, Jane Austen, Sylvia Barter, Dominic Rowan, Kate Beckinsale, Mark Strong, Samantha Bond, Diarmuid Lawrence, Andrew DaviesRaymond Coulthard, Bernard Hepton, Dido Miles, James Hazeldine, Samantha Morton, Prunella Scales, Guy Henry, Jane Austen, Sylvia Barter, Dominic Rowan, Kate Beckinsale, Mark Strong, Samantha Bond, Diarmuid Lawrence, Andrew Davies  See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.38 x 0.6 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Director': 'Diarmuid Lawrence', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 5, 2000', 'Actors': 'Kate Beckinsale, Bernard Hepton, Mark Strong, Samantha Bond, James Hazeldine', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'A&E Home Video', 'Writers': 'Andrew Davies, Jane Austen', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: With Kate Beckinsale in the lead, this should have been a whale of a movie, especially if Ms. Beckinsale was allowed to bring some of her persona from Cold Comfort Farm in which she played a more Emma-like character there than she was allowed to do here. Beckinsale's Emma was overly moody and had none of the light cheerfulness of Austen's Emma (or Ms. Paltrow's for that matter). Mark Stong is not Jeremey Northrup but he is VERY good. Unfortunately, this movie never establishes that Mr. Knightly is a daily presence in the Woodhouse household (i.e., compare with the Northrup-Paltrow version), which is critical to understanding the relationship between Mr. Knightly and Emma. Indeed, their love for each other is nearly a shocker in this version coming in its last 10 minutes. If you are an Emma fan, you may find this film a disappointment. In general, I prefer Ms. Beckinsale over Ms. Paltrow but Ms. Paltrow's film is a better Reader's Digest adaptation of this lengthly and rich novel. I wonder if modern movie/DVD audiences have the patience for a longer 4 and 6 hour versions of this novel akin to what has been done for Pride & Prejudice by the BBC and A&E, respectively. Indeed, the latest 2-hour version of P&P by Hollywood is a bare skeleton of that incredible story.
Review Title: Not quite Miss Jane's Emma
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2013/10/22
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'smoking'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Peter Jackson'], 'Producers': ['Peter Jackson', 'Fran Walsh', 'Carolynne Cunningham', 'Zane Weiner'], 'Starring': ['Sir Ian McKellen', 'Martin Freeman', 'Richard Armitage']}
Review Text: While I appreciate bringing elements of the appendices of LOTR into the Hobbit movies, beginning with this one, this movie is misguided in vision and execution.  Trying to craft another Aragorn out of Thorin is silly and disingenuous to the spirit of the dwarves.  Making this more about Thorin and not Bilbo is also not in keeping with the core elements of this story.  And then, all those chase scenes!  There were too many, and they way, way were too long. I stopped watching the movie for awhile.  If this keeps up, this series of films will be reminescent of the second Star Wars series with the young Anakin - and that series was a disaster in story telling.
Review Title: Way too many tedious chases
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Marvel's The Avengers
Review Date: 2013/11/26
Categories: Science Fiction, Adventure, Ambitious, Fantastic
Product Description: ['Marvel’s The Avengers is the Super Hero team up of a lifetime, featuring iconic Marvel Super Heroes Iron Man, The Incredible Hulk, Thor, Captain America, Hawkeye and Black Widow.']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Joss Whedon'], 'Producers': ['Kevin Feige'], 'Starring': ['Robert Downey Jr. Chris Evans']}
Review Text: Great one liners and actually some very nice acting here and there from Downey, Johansson and Ruffalo (the man can communicate a lot without uttering a word) but otherwise this was tepid story.  We watched The Avengers to get background on the Agents of SHIELD TV show, which we are enjoying.
Review Title: Great backstory for Agents of Shield - not much more
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2014/01/06
Average Rating: 4.6

Review Text: I watched this film for the second time on bluray and thoroughly enjoyed it.  The story line bears little relationship to the book, which turns out to be OK as the plague theme runs well in this adaptation.  Indeed, it makes for a nice double feature with the movie Contagion.
Review Title: Not the book but a lot of fun anyway
Rating: 4.0

Fuisz', 'Alfred R. Kelman', 'William F. Storke'], 'Starring': ['George C. Scott', 'Angela Pleasence', 'Edward Woodward'], 'Studio': ['20TH CENTURY FOX']}
Review Text: The title of this review says it all.  I think that if Roger Rees' version of Scoorge's nephew bore the same lightness that Barry Mackay did in the 1938 version, this might be the superior film.  Too many versions ignore the importance of the lightness that Fred brings to this story.
Review Title: Better than most but not the Reginald Owen 1938 version
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------

Review Date: 2014/01/08
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Kathryn Bigelow'], 'Producers': ['Colin Wilson', 'Greg Shapiro', 'Ted Schipper', 'Mark Boal', 'Kathryn Bigelow', 'Megan Ellison'], 'Starring': ['Jessica Chastain', 'Mark Strong', 'Joel Edgerton'], 'Studio': ['SONY PICTURES ENTERTAINMENT', 'INC.']}
Review Text: After what turned out to be the most entertaining exchange with the online help at Amazon Instant Video, we gave up trying to watch this video. DO NOT GET THIS ON AMAZON INSTANT VIDEO.  It will be a waste of $17 as  we are seeing more buffering time with Amazon Instant Video videos as we are movie....2-4 minutes of movie at a time.  By the time we ended our chat with the Amazon help, he had us unplugging everything.....I was waiting for him to tell us to go turn off the circuit at the circuit breaker or call the city to have them turn off power to our neighborhood....and then, reboot the move so that we can see 4-6 minutes of video at a time. By the way we have no problem with Netflix or Hulu+ steaming videos.
Review Title: Movie is great Amazon Instant Video is a disaster

Review Text: I am only half of the way into the first season as I write this.  Great cast; great, engaging characters. The plots are smart, witty, and engaging. Lucy Lui (as Joan Watson) is subtly outstanding, and Aidan Quinn (NYPD Captain) and Johnny Lee Miller (as Sherlock Holmes) are on their A-game. Marcus Bell is new to me but he does a lot with what little he is given to do.  Keep your eye on this guy.  This show is a great complement and contrast to Benedict Cumberbatch's and Martin Freeman's version of Homes and Watson, respectively, in "Sherlock."
Review Title: Sherlock Holmes in NYC!

Review Title: Great actors, great acting with a very nice story.

raw_response:
**Summary of Preferences and Trends:**

**Genres:**
- Strong preference for **Romance** and **Comedy**, particularly adaptations of classic literature.
- Enjoyment of **Science Fiction** and **Action/Adventure**, exemplified by superhero films.

**Actors/Directors:**
- Interest in performances by **Kate Beckinsale**, **Brad Pitt**, and **Bill Nighy**.
- Appreciation for directors such as **Peter Jackson** and **Joss Whedon**.

**Viewing Experiences:**
- Values character depth and engaging storylines; disappointed by films lacking narrative cohesion.
- Enjoys adaptations with faithful representations of source material but is open to reinterpretations if executed well.

**Ratings and Reviews:**
- Generally rates films around **4.0-4.8**, indicating a tendency towards enjoyment, though often critiquing execution or pacing.
- Discontent with overly stylized or minimalist films that fail to deliver substance.

**Technological Engagement:**
- Expressed frustrations with streaming platforms, particularly Amazon, indicating a preference for reliable viewing experiences.

**Overall Preferences:**
- Enjoys films that balance humor, emotional depth, and well-crafted storytelling, often influenced by character dynamics. Disappointed by adaptations that stray too far from original narratives.

target_interaction.title: Still greater than the some of its parts after 20 years
target_interaction.text: Just rewatched this after 20 years.  This holds up remarkably well. The characters are charming, funny, and the movie still has a slight edge.  I think Madanna missed her (other) calling.
